text:
Cask at Red Squirrel Amersham, 28/04/17.
Pale golden with little in the way of a head. 
Nose is varnish, pear drop, Orchard wood, sweet notes. 
Taste comprises floral notes, pear drops, straw, apple pie, honey blossom. 
Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, drying close. 
Ok.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Glass, 12 ounces, at the 2016 Swansea Beer & Cider Festival, trip to Swansea, Amsterdam and Paris with Louise, savoured on August 26 2016; eye: straw, no effervescence, no head, no lacing; nose: sweet, pear, acidity, light, refreshing; mouth: sweet, pear, acidity, light, refreshing, light musk, finale in pear with presence of musk, light body, average carbonation, slightly sweet, slick texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Verre, 12 onces, bue au 2016 Swansea Beer & Cider Festival, voyage à Swansea, Amsterdam et Paris avec Louise, savourée le 24 août 2016; il : paille, pas deffervescence, pas de mousse, pas de dentelle; nez : sucré, poire, acidité, léger, rafraîchissant; bouche : sucré, poire, acidité, léger, rafraîchissant, léger musc, finale en poire avec présence de musc, corps léger, carbonatation moyenne, très légèrement sucrée, texture coulante; en résumé : bien

September 23, 2015 - at Southampton Arms - handpull cask. With lagerloather. 4.5% ABV. Pale hazy gold, no head. Smells like apples, pears and alcohol - simple, tart. Slick, still, mildly acidity, finishes quick, emerging sweetness. Nice enough.

Cask @ Chelmsford Winter Beer festival. Pours light golden with an offwhite head. Aroma of apples, pear, tart apples. Flavor is rather sweet, apples, pear, sugar. Medium body, average carbonation, light sweet finish. 160217
Box @ Barum Top Inn, Halifax. Pale golden cider. Slightly dry, with a subdued sweetness, although an easy-drinking texture.

Cask HP at Hamilton Hall London as Gwynt y Ddraig Two Trees Perry. I believe this may be my 200th Welsh tick. How fitting for it to be a cider/perry rather than a beer. Its a brilliant gold (because clear yellow doesnt sound as good), still with no head. Aroma is airy pear juice, elderflower. Body is smooth with low carbonation. Taste is quenching sweet pear juice, lychee, some guava, kiwi notes. Mostly sweet pear, obviously. Really drinkable. Good.

BIAB at Tanners Hall JDW Darlington. Clear golden colour, white foam head and woody pear aroma. Taste is pear, fruity, melon with light woody and earthy notes. Slightly syrupy mouthfeel, light bodied, low carbonation, dry clean finish. Nicely drinkable.
50th Perry rate. Bag in box, royal tiger, wednesfield. Golden amber Perry with small bubbly head. Aroma of sweet pear. Taste is fresh pear juice, a hint of vanilla and some wood. Soft palate. Good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: JUL 17, 2016 Pours a clear light gold colour with a fragrant ripe pear aroma. Sweet as expected with a light pear flavour. A crisp and light dryness to the finish. Nice.

Cask from the White Lion, Norwich. Advertised at 4.5%. Bright gold, clear. Pear aroma with a trifling hint of oak. Taste.... my God this is sweet, but still delicious. Sugary pear drops on the finish. Enjoyable but maybe Id appreciate it more if it were bit less sweet...

[7774-20150927] Box. Vinegar and fruity skins aroma. Clear, bright dark yellow body with no lasting head. Sweet pear fruit and light apple juice flavour has a nice sweet juicy finish. Medium body. Strange aroma but otherwise good, easy to drink. (5-/2/7/3/11) 2.8
(@ Friends of Ham, Leeds, England)

2015-09-27. Crisp dark yellow body, headless. Aroma is mild, very lightly musky fruity character, light pear. 6+ Flavour is sweetish up front, fruity, very lightly dry pear notes. Smooth average bodied palate, still. Enjoyable but mild. At Friends of Ham, Leeds.
Draught @ 2015 Red Eye Cider Festival, The Salopian Bar, Shrewsbury. Pours clear gold with fruity perry pear aroma. Interesting rosy sweet perry taste, accessible and easy-drinking.
on tap oro leggermenten velato buona nota fruttata pera discreta secchezza un po di buccia
Cask at sraf 2015. Pours clear golden, nose is fruity, pear, taste is similar, sweet.
Cask at Isis Sunderland. Pours hazy pale yellow with a thin white head. Aromas of sulphur, cider, pears, apples. Taste is more of the same. Dry finish.
Cask. Sweet and sugary, apple juice-like. Some pear and citrus. Bland gold pour. I suppose it was drinkable enough and inoffensive, but simply not for me.
Hand pulled shepherd boy dewsbury. Aroma is mild pears. Clear copper colour no head. Taste is nice sweet pears slight tart finish. Decent body zero carbonated. Good perry.

Cloudy and very pale. Nose is complex...peat, leather, tannic stuff. Sweet front, some juicy pear taste. Quite mellow and approachable. Light citrus and spice to add nuance. Really this is a new thing for me and I lack frame of reference.
Keg at the Wellington Inn, Hull. Not much to sniff at, just a bit of a fresh aroma with a touch of fruit. Clightly cloudy with a tiny bit of fizz. Not tons of flavour, but perfectly pleasant.

Sweetish pearskins and juice, medium body, pale golden, no carbonation. Pear finish.
Cask @ Bree Louise, London. Clear golden without head. Aroma is sweet, apples, apple juice, sweet pears and light sulphur. Flavor is medium sweet. Dry finish. 041013
@ Bree Louise. Clear golden with no head. Aroma is pear, sweet and sugar. Flavour is pear, fruit, sugar, unbalanced,and sweet.

cask at leicester beer festival. pours a clear light yellow. interesting one. aroma is slightly spicy with flowers and of course pears present too. tastes very nice. full and long lasting flavour firstly of soft pears (as it should be) and minimal carbonation. ends with a little spice.

Gylden klar skum ingen 
Pære og ikke ting 
Bitter ikke sød moderate 
Flad vandede @cider tap 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Earnest and authentic, moderate sweet, low carbonation but not flat. Good balance and sparkling flavor. Im sympathetic to ciders of all stripes and compared to the drivel we get in the U.S., this was positively delightful. (cask at the Lady Grey, Newcastle)

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2014 [16/4/2012, cask at the William Robert Loosley (JDW), High Wycombe] Cloudy pale gold. Creamy, dry, light pear flavour.  In fact, like a dry pear milkshake.  There?s a spicy kick at the back of the throat.  It?s a strange perry, but I rather liked it by the end. 5/3/7/4/13.

Re-rate, 22/6/2014, on tap at Tweedies Bar,  Grasmere.  Clear gold. Flat,  smooth,  creamy, almost cloying mouthfeel- felt it needed a bit more life to it. Flavour is more apples than pears,  with some vanilla- if I hadnt have known it was a perry I might have thought it was a sweet cider. The sweetness is eased by the light body. Definitely one for the mass-market, its easy-drinking and inoffensive. 5/3/5/3/11.

Score is the average of both ratings.
Bag in box @ The Beehive, Gatwick Airport. No head. Color is clear yellow. Aroma and taste are rich and fruity with lots of sweet perries. Full bodied and soft carbonated.
Draught at the Beehive, Gatwick. Clear greenish yellow colour. Light perry aroma. Moderate perry flavor. Semi sweet. Average finish. Oily palate. Fresh nice perry.

Subtle aroma of pear (very slight indeed) Slight carbonation with very light straw colour. Hint of pear otherwise very little else to tase. Very drinkable with a wide range of foods as it is not overbearing in its nature.

Cask at The Crosse Keys, JDW, London. Pours a clear, very pale yellow with no head. Sugar and fruit nose. Flavor is sweet and very juice-like, with just hints of tartness. Light to medium bodied with almost no carbonation. Light dry finish, pears and apples, faint must, sugar. Easy to drink.

On draught at The Standing Order. Pours a straw colour with an aroma of pear drops, alcohol and caramel. A quite prominent fresh pear flavour and a little honey also. Quite a dry finish with mild carbonation. Not bad although a little sweet for me.
From hand pump at a Wetherspoons. Cloudy straw with no head. Sweet, sticky pear drink, claggy and a little unpleasant.
From Polypin @ Esquire House, JDW. Clear white wine coloured, no head. Nose is pear lemonade, juicy, sugar. Flavour is pear juice, little citrus. Sweet finish.

Barrel, William Wygston, Wigston.  Pale straw with no carbonation.  Aromas are tinned pear juice with icing sugar and lemon.  Some surprising pineapple with light woody notes.  Flavours are sweet pear and pineapple juice with some green apple and vinegar tartness.  Fairly dry on the finish with sugar.  Light bodied.  Quite a strange perry.

Draft. A light yellow perry. The aroma has primary notes of pears combined with light notes of vinegar. The flavor is sweet with primary notes of pears, combined with lighter notes of vinegar, leading to a lightly tart finish.

Cask at 4,5% ABV.
Pours a cloudy, pale straw.
Lots of pears on the nose, apple peel, apples, yeast, grapefruit, grass, wax.
Semi sweet, light bodied.
Fruity taste, lots of pears, quite astringent, apple peel, yeast, a bit tart. Quite refreshing. (2011-08-04)

Cask (handpump) @ Fat Cat, 23 Alma Street, Sheffield, South Yorkshire England S3 8SA.Clear light yellow color with virtually none head. Aroma is light oear, barnyard notes. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is flat. [20100426]

Cask Stillage at the ABC Festival, Altrincham Market 29/08/2010
Fruity aroma. Light golden coloured with a slightly fruity pear flavour. A hint of dryness in a lasting finish.

Grayish yellow colour with no head. Aroma is pear, some slight apple with mild wooden and honeyish notes as well. Flavour is pear, a bit citrusy along with some earthy and honeyish notes. Semi-mouthdrying.

On tap at The Pigs Summer Beer Festival 10, at the Pig and Falcon, St Neots, Cambridgeshire. Hazy silver grey with some white floaty bits. Aroma of slightly stale ripe pear. Fruity taste, quite sweet, but with a distinct citric edge.
poly cask at SRAF 2010 ... pale pee yellow ... soft musty pear ... soft sweet pear ... very thing ... peally wally ... quite a poor perry.

Polycask that friend Bob brought along to Fairports Cropredy Convention Festival 14th Aug 09   Poured hazy Robinson Barley Water colour. Aroma was peary. Taste was good, though noticeably tangier and a little drier than many perries that Ive had, tasty and refreshing stuff.  A6 A3 F7 P4 Ov12  3.2

From a bag in a box at the Commercial Rooms (JDW), Bristol 08/06/09. Very pale green with no head and little carbonation. Sweetish pear fruit aroma with a whiff of spice. Flavour had plenty of tart fruit to start before a sweetish finish. Drinkable.
(Cask at GBBF, London, 7 Aug 2008) Greenish yellow colour with no head. Fruity, tart nose with notes of unripe pears. Fruity, tart taste with a good pear character, medium sweet. Decent perry.

Comments: This would be a very good perry by most other producers, but Im afraid their blended varietals remain tops.

A Mes rate: 
Barrel at GBBF. Standard perry looks but this is no standard perry. Dry pear drops and funky. Wonderful sourness. Tannin laiden finish. So drinkable and puckery. Totally lovely.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2014 From the barrel - GBBF 2007.  A hazy light lime green coloured perry.  The aroma is nice and sweet pears.  The taste is nice and fruity.  Good sweet pears with brown sugar.  Slips down so easily, so lovely and drinkable.  Score 3.7Subsequent rating scored 3.4. Average becomes 3.6

Barrel at Ealing BF 2007.  Cloudy green, silver and gold with no head.  Some pear juice on aroma, verging on the vinegar, some sugary pear juice in mouth.  Good to have a palate cleanser.  Tinned pear fruit on finish.  Too sweet for me.
